summary: A tribe of cats must decide yearly which one will ascend to the Heaviside Layer and come back to a new life.

With tarnished storylines, an overpurr-fected cast, and a story that bears little to no resemblance to the original Broadway play, Tom Hooper turns one of the smartest of names in the hall of Broadway into a musical mishap of tremendous paw-portions. If you're in fact a cat person, then you will surely want to go and buy a dog after watching Cats.

Visualmente bonito, mas extremamente musical e chato, o roteiro também não me atrai, curto o trio, Idris, Reben e Taylor, mas aqui foi difícil vencer, bonitinho, mas ordinário, mentira, muito bem produzido, mas entendiante… Fui até o final somente por questão de honra, pois a vontade foi desistir nos primeiros 10 minutos, apesar de visualmente perfeito, principalmente chato, roteiramente entediante...

I actually quite enjoyed the dance numbers and songs, but found the storyline to be disjointed at times. Particularly intrigued due to recently having read T. S. Elliot's book of poems inspiring the musical (and film).

Uncanny valley, boring, and an overall bad adaptation. The one good thing i can say about this movie is that it tries to be something new while so many other bad movies just give us the same thing over and over again. So while it is abysmal at least it is something different.

Okay idk what people were expecting when they watched this, but they're wrong and Cats is good. You have to remember that the original poem was written by TS Eliot, which helps explain why most people can't follow it. Or why many of these reviews boldly claim that there is no plot. I actually thought the plot was easier to follow here than either the play or the original poem. Maybe it's because the plot revolves around the anticipatory revelation of the next "jellicle" cat, which is never defined, but that's what makes Cats special. It's unfamiliar. It's unclear. But it's magical. 

I would recommend folks go into this with a little background on Eliot and modernism in general. Personally, I don't like modernism for this very reason. It's referential, in that it contains allusions to prior work (one Cat even refers to their surroundings as a "wasteland"). This context makes the whole film a bizarre and grotesque modernist interpretation not only of the play Cats, but of the poem Cats (originally titled Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats). It makes the whole experience hilarious and infinitely more interesting and fun. TS Eliot probably would have hated it, which brings me great joy because I sort of hate TS Eliot. 

The performances and songs are good. The cats look creepy, but that's sort of the point. Again, wtf were people expecting?? I went into this film assuming it would be the worst thing I had ever seen given the reputation it has, and when it ended I can honestly say it was one of the more engaging and entertaining films I've seen in a while. Highly recommended, just temper your expectations before viewing. You're not about to watch a Hollywood movie, you're going to watch an abstract and hard-to-follow art film veiled as a Hollywood movie by the star-studded cast.

I was not too fond of the stage version mainly due to it being more dance oriented but besides that the movie has some really good performances in particularly Jennifer Hudson's powerful delivery of "Memory" and Francesca Hayward who plays Victoria did absolutely fantastic on the movie.

I will say this despite the CGI for the cats and mice, it's very questionable, but I think the performances and set pieces make up for that, so overall this makes a good adaptation ❤️

One of the few West End musicals I haven't watched, and having seen the film, thank the Lord I didn't spend a couple of hundred pounds seeing this crap. How can I  best sum up this film??? Well, I've never taken LSD or any psychedelic mind-altering drugs; however, I should imagine the effects would be similar to watching this film!! I watched it free on Amazon Prime Video in five sittings!! I found watching it after several G & T's was the only way to withstand the kaleidoscope of images and arbitrary singing going on. I did have several fits of laughter, but not at any parts the makers wanted to make amusing. A couple of times, I turned the volume down to zero as this helped me get through to the end. I think the guy doing the CGI either got bored or lost the will to live whilst animating this mess. Having watched it, I still couldn't tell you what the film's storyline was.
No offense to people who love the musical but four words: Curiosity has killed this movie.

Quite possibly the worst widescreen theatrical release of the decade.   Some musicals are watchable, but unless you are fully familiar with the storyline, almost everything that happens in CATS will go right over your head.  I saw the Broadway play when I was a little kid and remembered nothing except for a few melodies that were frequently advertised on TV commercials.  The film's budget says 100 million, but the whole movie seems like it was filmed on one stage with no special effects spanning beyond the digital fluff on their costumes.

The only worse film is ''Spencer''.

This is one of the rare times that I'm going to disagree with the critics. My friend and I watched the movie version of one of the longest-running Broadway musicals, Cats, with low expectations. To be honest, we missed the local staging of the musical, so we opted in watching the movie instead. Also because we wanted to know the story. But we were pleasantly surprised. We didn't find the CGI enhancements weird or "nightmarish."  In fact, we thought the moving ears and tails made them look better. Acting was great and the choreography was excellent. Some of the songs were quite good, to be honest.  Personally, I wouldn't say that Jennifer Hudson's rendition of "Memory" was one of the greatest, but it sure was heartfelt. Judi Dench and Idris Elba looked great here. Francesca Hayward is an excellent dancer, plus she knows how to act. We genuinely liked the movie, so I suppose it's just a matter of taste. For us, it felt like we were watching a Disney or Tim Burton movie. So, to each his own, I guess.
this movie was ok i don't really like it that much

If you want a good musical with good singing & Thundercats cosplay, you watch the 1998 movie.  🐈🐈🐈

If you want s hilarious trainwreck with real faces superimposed over bad CGI you & a friend can laugh at together, you watch this.  🐈🐈🐈

Yeah, this version has no costumes, it's CGI. If you think the costumes are good, you either rented the 90s version, or you can't tell CGI from reality.  🐈🐈🐈

But like I said, it's bad to the point of being funny, so don't take it seriously & think of it as a comedy, like The Room, or any number of severely botched buggy video games with hilarious glitches. I'm sure by 2029 it will become a cult classic.  🐈🐈🐈

The music in this version is a travesty though. Manages to botch every single song, choking the melody with drama. Not something I would listen to in a car or studying. Barbara Streisand did an excellent cover of Memory. Elaine Page gave audiences goosebumps in a good way. Jennifer Hudson is an actress, not a singer, & the song really suffers for it. Being the most important song in the musical, it's actually a travesty of a cover. 🐈🐈🐈

& you might as well watch both versions, because it has made sooo many tweaks to the plot & characters, adding new characters that remove the agency of established characters, replacing characters, consolidating characters, altering the plot, changing the protagonist, having a protagonist show up before the halfway mark, changing the end through a misinterpretation of the lyrics, turning songs that should have 4 singers into solos, messing up the tempo & the melody... Both movies will give you different experiences.

Short review:  One stellar number, one good number, and a lot of bad stuff.  How anyone could make a musical and think it's ok to have bad musical performances is totally beyond me.

Longer review:  I've seen... ok that's not correct... I've fast forwarded through Cats, stopping to sample here and there and staying longer if it's interesting.

The absolute worst number, musically, was Jenny Annie Dots, performed by ...what's her name... Rebel Wilson. I know she's done musicals before but she was strangely off pitch and off beat for the entire performance. Sad, because I really enjoyed the original stage version of that number.

Second worse, and it pains me to say it, was Sir Ian McKellen as Gus the Theater Cat. I mean, I've seen the theater production several times and have the DVD from that, and the original is very nostalgic and melancholy, but the movie performance is just ... sad. Like seeing a great actor trapped in a character he just can't get his arms around. His song just wanders, as the instruments struggle to keep up. See the original, it's heartrending. Which I guess the movie performance also is, for an entirely different reason.

There ARE good performances. Taylor Swift's McCavity is decent. But by far, the gem of the film, is Skimbleshanks the railway cat. This is a magnificent number that improves dramatically on the original, which was -- let's face it -- a little on the boring side. But the movie version has an amazing tap dance number and visuals that go way beyond what you could do on stage and a performance that's unmatched in the rest of the film. It's almost worth sitting through the movie just for that segment. This is what the the rest of the movie SHOULD have been.

There's a good video on youtube about why the music in the Cats film is so poor. It's called

Why the Music in Cats is Worse than you Thought and is worth watching.

So yeah, the fur effects were sketchy-to-revolting, some of the casting choices didn't make any sense, and most of the songs did not work. The songs themselves are fine, (see the stage play) it's the performance that's not up to par. As "Sideways" says in his video, we weren't watching a movie, we were watching the world's most expensive rehearsal.

And yet... the Skimbleshanks number gives us an idea of what the film could have been, had better decisions been made.

The reason Skimbleshanks and McCavity worked when the others didn't, is the director's decision to let the vocalists of those other numbers improv on stage, and task the orchestra with doing their best to keep up. This left performances that were not only off key a bit but were also all over the place timing-wise. In contrast, the two numbers that WORKED are the only ones done to a click track, to keep everyone on time. Skimbleshanks because of the unusual time signature (13/8) and McCavity because... well let's face it, Taylor Swift doesn't sing in the shower without a click track. She couldn't afford to have a bad performance on her resume.

But two good performances, perhaps totaling seventeen minutes, does not save a nearly two hour film.

But like a bad superbowl game, you can always see the good bits on youtube later.

'Cats' is the film equivalent of being force-fed LSD and immediately forced to sprint through a marathon, surrounded by anthropomorphic clowns who, though forbidden from physically hurting you, specialize in assaulting your soul. A mind-numbing, eye-gauging slog that, if not for the two I own, would make me swear off domestic felines entirely. Reserve this for self-flagellation or intentionally turning your children into serial killers.

Cats is a disappointing film. It is about a tribe of cats called the Jellicles who must decide yearly which one will ascend to the Heaviside Layer and come back to a new Jellicle life. James Corden and Judi Dench give horrible performances. The screenplay is badly written. Tom Hooper did a terrible job directing this motion picture. I was not impressed with this motion picture.

Despite Hooper's stylistic choices that were a little off, Cats isn't as bad of a movie as I thought. I just watched it last night with high expectations after watching the 1998 film the night before, and Hooper did make a musical. Some things he definitely did wrong, but it isn't the horror show I thought it was going to be.
Never seen it but this film is the worst musical film of the year, ever. Bad VFX, bad CGI, and bad editing. That was so awful and even cringe-worthy. This is an absolute bad film for all of us.
Look, I'm a fan of the musical, but I don't think I could EVER finish talking about how much I hate this movie

Leave Cats alone. Despite the somewhat jarring appearance of the Cats, Cats is a fun movie and not a waste of your time. People went into the film with the mindset it was going to be bad and it shows, from it's undeserved low rating. Worth watching.

From a theatre show perspective, the movie allows diverse environments and actions that are not possible in a normal theatre show production, but what's missing is conflict like gangster cat violence and how to "magically defeat" gangster violence without bloodshed and weapons. If I want to take Cats to the next level, the sequel Cats 2 would be multi-cultural, multi-talented like those from America's Got Talent to create a whole new multi-dimensional  circus side of cats on a global festival music scale from all continents: Asian, African, Polynesian, European etc.

All they did was add a few extra lines, added a few extra places and called it a script. Then they added useless characters that had no use in the story at all just so they can have more celebrities on. I’d also like to add that the editors clicks have made the characters less creepy. Honestly this entire movie movie could have been an animated movie for kids. The fur just looked like really weird body suits that made everyone seem naked it felt awkward to watch.

It's not like I've been a huge cats fan all my life. I only got into it a few days ago and I watched this movie before the 1998 version. Well, watched is generous because I made it halfway and then turned it off and went to bed, only to have nightmares of humanoid cat things with human faces and cat ears but human hands and feet??? The cgi is uncanny and terrifying, but after watching the superior 1998 version, it makes me mad how much they butchered the characters. I could write an essay on it, but I don't want to think about it any further and more experienced critics have. I have no idea what prompted a 53% for the audience rating because this movie is hot garbage. Should I even mention how giving a story with no plot a protagonist is a terrible idea? Overall, I wouldn't even wish this movie on my worst enemies. It's full of wasted potential and is a massive disappointment. If I could rate it zero stars, I would. If I could rate it negative stars, I 100% would. I feel so bad for every single fan of the original musical, especially the diehard ones. 10% of the movie is okay and the other 90% is terrible. They got talented actors and managed to make them sound bad. It's unbelievable how bad a movie can be.
This movie is boring, the actors look weird, and it feels like it goes on for hours. Some (not all) of the music is good.

What The hell did I just watch?!! It was great to hear J-HUD sing but this was the oddest story. I didn’t mind the CGI effects but the overall story is just odd.

My wife made ma watch this over the holidays, and wouldn't let me tap out after about 20 minutes, so I was forced to watch this whole, entire, ridiculous thing.  I am not a fan of musicals, but I don't think musicals are usually filled with singers that can't sing.  The costumes were weird, the story was silly, and seriously, can't they afford an auto tune patch in their studio?
Nothing beats the old stuff, and with this movie, it was no exception. Give me the original any day!

I saw this movie because I have been trying to watch bad movies and let me say THID WAS A BAD MOVIE! The CGI was horrifying with green screened faces on cockroaches, and at some parts of the movie they bring out claws but because the fingers and most of the feets cgi was never finished claws some out of human fingers awkwardly. Not even the songs are that good! I own a cat and I will never look at him the same way.

You've got to relax your eyes, my friends, and let the waves of furry thighs wash over you.  I found this no harder to get into than Avengers EG or IW.  In fact, if you're a super-hero flick fan and you've ever wondered how a superhero movie appears to an outsider, Cats could give you that experience.  Weird costumes, strange powers, and everyone seems enthralled and in on a joke you can't quite understand.

I really don't know why this got such bad reviews. The animation was amazing. The musical itself is unique and I think this movie really shows that. The sets are amazing and the cast for this is phenomenal. I wish people got over the animation because really this was a great adaption
I'm really scared now, I kept saying ew during the film. It's so creepy
Every review you've read/seen is justified.

It was a year ago exactly today that I went to see Cats in theaters with two friends. We thought a Christmas Eve viewing would be fun, so we booked the tickets on a whim, just to see if the movie stood up to all of the... "hype." The theater was empty except for an older couple sitting a few rows behind us, and we sat maskless as the opening scene played. That is when I realized what exactly this movie was. The cats moved weird and kind of grossed me out. The pacing felt off, and at times, I felt like the movie was holding me hostage, frozen in my seat. That scene in the middle of the movie where the cats all perform some strange dance and collapse in some sex-fueled exhaustion was honestly scarring and made me cry in the seat.

Looking back on it all now, knowing that was the last time I saw my friends in a public setting just to have fun before we went back to college (and then coming back home not long after), I cherish this movie. Yeah, it's bad. I love thinking about it. I would never watch it again, but the very memory of just sitting next to my friends and laughing at this movie is enough for me to give it 3.5 stars.

Also, the railroad song was pretty good.

Despite its fur-mirable cast, this "Cats" adaptation (which is worthy of The Burnin' Medallion Of Badness, mainly thanks to the poor CGI) is a clawful mistake that will leave most viewers begging to be put out of their mew-sery. Characters (most of whom are familiar): 1/5 Story (also familiar): 1/5 Acting: 0.5/5 Special Effects: 0/5 Direction: 0/5 Cinematography: 2.5/5 Soundtrack (mostly songs from the musical it's based on): 3/5 Overall: 1/5

The fact that the Director needs to put "punch on the testicles" joke, the horrific visuals just for CGI sake, the akward scenes for no more purpose than...i really don´t know why. I think this movie ill be on the worst movies pantheon for being everything and nothing at the same time. They bring popular celebrities for lame disgusting jokes and great pedigree actors for bland or no profound impact in the movie. What im triying to say is: The Director failed using such talent of Sirs and Dames, thought that the audience will be entertained with just some pop stars doing "obnoxious" children jokes. It was not a fun, popcorn, semi dumb movie like Fast and Furious or Transformers, neither a profound sentimental drama, nor a visually pleasing Artistic expression, nor a funny wacky sketch.

Simply, those who rated Cats as one of the worst movies ever, either should watch more movies or should watch this movie without trying to recognize the theatrical show. Hopper's effort is not flawless but has set its own peculiar and original aesthetics, which is remarkable in an exclusive way.

OOF! This was such a horrifying movie. Those aren't cats, they don't look like cats, they don't act like cats, so why on Earth is the movie cats? And also what does Jellicle mean? They say it probably more than 50 times and no one explains the meaning. Plz help, I'm still having nightmares. This film is worse than the emoji movie, sinister 2, and rings combined! I would rather eat a giant bowl of beans than watch this horrible piece of nasty tuna fish ice cream. Sorry if I ruined ice cream for you. I would rather eat spinach dipped in bean juice than watch these ugly, stupid piles of rear end

In the beginning, you can already see that they broke fundemental laws of a musical. I mean, there are no written laws to a musical, just basic production productions. It's just not making sense to me. they go from being regular sized humans, to being small, then big again in a matter of seconds. Yes, the magic of musicals, but you also want to make musicals realistic, even though it will be completely fiction. Talking cats, that i get, but what i dont get, is why the budget for this movie is 95 million. I think that, the money should have gone to far better things than this movie. Who knew, that i would be writting a review about cats, in 2020.  I now can finally say "im crying because of a movie" and actually mean it. 
	The Characters are introduced without even an introduction. They have magic? Where is the monolouge? maybe I am missing the whole point, but what even is the point? I never think practically when i watch musicals, movies, plays, or shows, because i just automatically think, It's all part of the act. The actors didnt know that the movie they were going to act in would get a bad reputation as soon as it came out. Again, there are too many music numbers. Where is the monolouge? I mean, there is some, but the cuts, and scene changes make no sense. The plot? what even is it?  
Yes, this movie is about cats, but it doesnt follow a single plot. You know how when we babble when we get excited. A run on sentence in real life pretty much. That is what i think this movie is. A RUN ON SENTENCE. 
	It is repetitive....
	Repulsive
	Conlicted....
It seems as if there is no true resolution to the conflict that was placed in the beginning. My father told me to give this musical a chance, because i tend to dislike things without even getting to know it. I did give it a chance, and i take it back. On very rare occasions do i ever regret things, but this, this, is the one i most regret. GIVING IT ANOTHER CHANCE. 
	A cat version of a surf and turf war.....
The dance battle made no sense. So are they friends or enemies. 
Maybe i should write like how the movie is made. One big repetitive, run on sentence. Or maybe i can create one of dogs. 
	Oh, look the main character is scared and overwhelemed. Didnt see that coming. 
So is the setting, in some abandoned city? Where the cats are small, yet giants at the same time?  Am I truly missing something? I am not bored, I am HORRIFIED. dance with ghosts? what???? 
	It is too edited. This truly overwhelms me. Realism? I have a lot concerns, and questions. 
Notice, how I am not writing with proper grammar, or writing properly. That is how i think the movie was written. So, I will write in such manner, that truly highlights the movie. 
Am I being mean? Maybe, but I am being honest. 
So is this movie, meant to be dramatic or comedic, or entertaining. Because i saw none of that. A little drama, but not enough to catch once eye. I mean, i must admit, amazing choreography. 
	CHAOTIC
	CONFUSING
Again, i am lost. A train? They are the size of toddlers now??? 
You can tell that some people lied about the movie on some reviews. 5 stars, a bit much. 3 is understandle. 
	Arent you supposed to introduce characters in someway? doesnt really matter the name. It matters on what role they play. RELATIONS, where is that? 
	Love interest? Where in the world is the main character? Did those two cats just disappear in that boat? What are they signing about? Cavity, ghosts, or did they just throw in abunch of random words, and said "it rhymes, so it must work".
	Is this jazz, blues, or whatever you call this? THERE IS NO SET PLOT. 
	What is going on? You dont know? I dont either? maybe that's the plot. THERE ISNT ONE. MAGIC POWDER. My cavity, or macavity? 
	Where did they get the magic? how? Where is the story line? what does it follow? these are questions that are not answered in the movie. Try to justify it, and you would just go mad trying to explain it. 

"walk the plank"???? are they pirate cats now? What is going on? Is it night forever? or is this like a werewolf type of situation, where they are actually humans that turn into cats during the night? 
How can one sing, nonstop? A migrain waiting to happen. 
I am done, this movie, doesnt deserve a chance. This doesn't deserve to be praised. 
Good day, and Good bye. 
	On the behalf of the people who watched this film, I am sorry for telling the harsh truth, and my harsh opinion. (I'm not really sorry)
The only good thing about this movie is that I discovered I'm in to furry shit

I know. The reviews were negative. Nobody has to tell me. But this seems more a case of "follow the leader." People want to hop on the bandwagon. They're natural conformists without even knowing why. Good. Now that we've gotten that out of the way, let's give a capsule review.

"Cats" is a splendid take on the Broadway play. The choreography, lighting, music and set design were magnificent. The fact that most critics, without actually explaining why, despised the movie doesn't mean I have to follow suit. Tom Hooper, who came out with "Les Miserables" in 2012, has made another great film. 

I guess I'm just a natural-born contrarian.

1.5/10. 'Cats' is the film equivalent of being force-fed LSD and being immediately forced to sprint through a marathon, surrounded by anthropomorphic clowns who, though forbidden from physically hurting you, settle for assaulting your soul. A mind-numbing, eye-gauging slog that, if not for the two I own, would make me swear off domestic felines entirely. Reserve this for self-flagellation or intentionally turning your children into serial killers.

I only watched this movie once and once is enough. I don't think that I'd watch it again. I wanted to see what all the hype was about with this movie. I was all set like 10 mins. in but pushed myself to finish it. I seen the original Cats movie from the 80's and this one, and both are terrible. I was really confused by this movie and did not know what was happening or what it is about etc... I feel awful for the people that payed money to see this sh*tshow of a movie. Not that much you can say about this movie, weird cgi, costumes, terrible songs/dancing etc... It's a waste of talent because this movie had a lot of well known actors. This movie in my opinion is not even worth one watch, just a really awful movie 1/2 star.
this is the most horrifying thing i've ever seen in my life
This gave me nightmares.
The opening scene gave me hope, but after that it was simply a mess. The stage version Andrew Lloyd Weber made available online at the beginning of the pandemic lockdowns is far superior.
My first memories are watching saw and the grudge etc but this movie is 10x more haunting

It's my understanding that if you don't know the story, the movie would be boring. I've seen the play and read recaps of what it's about so I was prepared for the story. Really, watched this with my whole family. It wasn't nearly as bad as most the critics seemed to indicate. Taylor Swift singing Macavity was surprisingly awesome. Jennifer Hudson singing Memory was so powerful, raw, and real. When you know that Dame Judi Dench injured her achilles right before she was to star in the original production makes watching her play Deuteronomy that much more satisfying. Rebel Wilson and James Corden make their roles more fun and enjoyable to watch. My kids have been asking to hear the music ever since.

I am a lover of the original Cats musical, and like most people I expected to be disappointed, but I wasn't. Admittedly, watching it live is far better than watching on a screen, but I still enjoyed the story. I loved how they gave Victoria more of a background and personality that you don't see in the live version, but the performance of Grizabella live far outweighs the movie's version. Rebel was also hilarious as Jenny and made me laugh a few times. All of my favorite songs were included, plus a few extras created specifically for the movie. All in all, I highly recommend both experiences.

Uncanny Valley, Island of Dr. Moreau, Cats.  This movie is special.  Sure the animation doesn't always look correct, but that is what makes it so damn good.  This is the most tripped out Disney movie I've ever seen.  Sleeping Beauty and Cats are now my Disney favorites.  Cats is now a cult classic, not for the mainstream lens.  Bravo, to the cast. I am sorry everyone attacked this movie.  So, grab a bag of edibles, turn off the lights , and get ready to sing!  Unless, you are a dog person....

I was waiting to be disappointed but enjoyed the movie in the cinema and on DVD. The dancing is worth the watch - spectacular. There are some shaky bits and the last scene is too long but it doesn't deserve the planning it got from the critics.

I know what the critics have said BUT I loved it.  I was thoroughly entertained.  Judi Dench could read the manual to an IKEA project and I would savor the time spent and listen to every word.  Ian McKellen is a treasure.  James Corden and Rebel Wilson were a hoot.   I am a big TSwift fan.  The ballerina, Francesca Hayward was stunning. Idris...what more can I say but his name followed by a growly meow!  Jennifer Hudson's performance of Memory gave me goosebumps.  I know that it is sloppy in plot and ruff and tumble but the dancing was beautiful and for a time I was transported to a place just focused on the follies of cats.  Given the current day and time and all that we face, I would willingly return to the world of Cats.  Cue up Judi, please.
This is actually the worst movie I've seen, and i refuse to acknowledge it. I had a total breakdown after 35 minutes and couldn't bear the pain anymore. I have no idea how they legally made this

Cats is genuinely one of my favorite movies of all times. Now I know you may be thinking I am absolutely insane but hear me out. This movie is objectively bad. Everything about. The visuals. The plot. The pacing. The expressions. The setting. And most definitely, The cats. This movie is horrid, gross, and disgusting and oh my god I love it. Ever since I first heard this movie was going to be made and saw an image of it I just knew I was going to love it. Unintentionally this movie is so absurd and amusing that it leads to an experience that is laughable and hilarious. When I first saw Cats it was about a month or two after its release and the reviews were already out there. The consensus among these reviews was an obvious "This movie is one of the worst cinematic experiences I've ever been a part of". Movie critics have a job and that is to give a professional opinion on whether or not they enjoyed a movie. Unfortunately this job entails an incredibly stuck up attitude that usually fogs up their perception of a movie and not taking it for what it is, entertainment. We all knew Cats was a cash grab, from the star studded cast to the budget alone that was entirely apparent. But what critics don't seem to realize is that even though it was a critical and box office failure, Cats succeeded at one thing and that was being pure unadulterated entertainment. Although it was a huge waste of money, Cats is a movie that will be ingrained in the brains of our society for a very long time.  One of my favorite pastimes, and I'm sure many of yours too, is to watch cringeworthy or just terrible things whether it be movies, television, or YouTube videos. Cats is a movie I have watched four times and I'm sure as you have guessed is no exception to being one of these things I like to watch. Even though it is cringeworthy and terrible Cats is a movie that doesn't let you look away; unlike many unwatchable movies, Cats is a movie that takes a risk and doesn't end up being boring or bland. So yes I love Cats and yes I want so much more content like it.
2020 was gods way of punishing mankind for this god forsaken movie.

I am a cat lover. Honestly, I don't like this movie. The cast has wonderful actors, but the movie was confusing. Also, the songs suck! I could not understand the plot line. Not to mention the cats are so little!!! They are even smaller than the table. An actual cat would be bigger and not that skinny. I was shocked at how bad this film is. I tried to understand, but after 30 minutes I stopped watching the movie. Honestly, this is a waste of time and you should not spend time watching this. It is weird. The cats don't wear any clothes and just look weird. If the music was good, I might have given this a two star review. The actors are doing good with the movements, but after a while I got bored. This offended me because I LOVE cats. I was excited to watch a movie about cats, but they just put a bunch of boring songs. It is a confusing movie. This movie is not good, so don't waste your time watching this with your family.
Really bad, boring, confusing and a real let down

Ignore the critics-I saw the original show and was disappointed (years before it became a theatre punch line).  They've fleshed out the story and the characters and made it more than just a collection of songs.  Cinema verite it isn't-but as a musical its fine.
What was that ? How, just how could Tom Hooper -- or any of the many, many people in the project --- not see everything that is wrong with this terrible visual experience ?

This is one musical that should stay as stage Broadway musical and should have never been made as a movie. The movie lacked excitement, made it more confusing for the audience. 

The Broadway musical is/ was 10x better.

the move was rotten shit we were toyyed with absolutely by a director with bad writing expierience he made cats from adorable to disgusting he made this by watching cat porn 

worst part theres no story its just a captured cat by 3--2 hours of singing this movie is a constipate depressed tean with cancer and dwarfism and daibeates

I have seen the Andrew Lloyd Webber musical many times. I also used to work in a theatre and have had a unique opportunity to talk to many theatre patrons. You either like it or hate it. The reason so many people don't like this movie (or the musical)  is because it doesn't make sense like a typical movie would. Did Rocky Horror Picture Show make any sense? Neither does Cats and that ok! There is no beginning, middle or end. There is no real plot, and it's based off of TS Elliot's book of poems. It's meant to be lighthearted fun, and geared at kids. Isn't the whole reason we go to the movies or show is to escape reality? This movie has a ton of great stars, fantastic music and dancing and it is pretty true to the original musical- for the most part. I enjoyed it and don't see anything wrong with the CGI work that they did. In fact it looks like they did a lot of great CGI work to make them look And movie like cats. I like it and think people should not listen to critics. Have fun, relax and watch it with an open mind.

I really enjoyed it. I went into watching it prepared for a train wreck, but I thought it was really good.  The music and choreography were great. The casting and performance were excellent. Whoever worked on animating the ears and tails are brilliant. For me, they added even more emotion to the songs and body language. I loved Cats as a stage production. There were differences, but I didn't see enough to justify all the criticism that the movie got.
Taylor Swift's song was pretty good, but otherwise this movie was totally forgettable.  And to be honest, strange.  Very strange.
It is rotten. The costumes were rotten, the casting was rotten, the dancing was really rotten, and it even managed to make the music and songs sound rotten.  Really.
even the kindergarteners like this musical
You're wrong. This movie is great.

This movie is MUCH better than the critics made it out to be. The dancing is outstanding. The principal dancer who plays Victoria is amazing.  You have to understand that the story is based on a 1939 poetry collection Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats by T. S. Eliot, which accounts for its off-beat plot. Andrew Lloyd Weber isn't my favorite composer...but when you place T.S.Elliot, Weber, and a London backdrop together (as the movie version does), it all starts to fit.
Omg this movie sucks, I couldn't watch it for 10 minutes without wanting to put a bullet in my Brain. Amazingly annoying and Horrible!
What the heck was this??? You know this is an utterly horrible film when they even find a way to completely ruin the best song, ‘Memories’. Garbage!

I checked this out at the library - free - cause I had to see if it really deserved all those Razzie awards, if it was truly bad.  I was surprised.  It looked good, had maybe 4 very good songs (Macavity, Train Man, Gus the theatre guy, Memories), overall dancing very good especially by the Train Man-but all choreography outdated.  Idris Elba as Macavity stole every scene in which he appeared. Rum Tum Tugger (!!!) played by Jason Derulo very good. Ian McKellen as Gus gave a totally professional performance. And Jennifer Holmes can certainly belt out "Memories."  Rebel and Judi-absolutely miscast.  I'd never seen the play, didn't understand the attraction.  It's odd, and blazingly bright and colorful, so for those reasons see it.  Worst thing?Bad:  It's a rather messy storyline and is the music pure old-school broadway (Hamilton changed stage shows for good and I think that's the biggest problem: after Hamilton, Cats isn't relevant as a show/movie.)  We will forever watch Phantom of Opera, Les Miserables, Sound of Music and more because every song was great. But not so with Cats. This show may have looked great on stage, but the close-ups in the film looked like hairy humans, not cats at all.  This just wasn't movie material.  But it's like nothing else. Oh, Taylor Swift fine, but her entrance is the BIG entrance in the entire movie and her roll is so small the entrance didn't make sense. I have seen on youtube the exit-to-the-stars at the end of the stage show and I have no idea why Hopper changed it so much for the film. But again, it's like no other movie ever.  And it could very well have a huge cult following in the future.  Like I said, the film appearing AFTER "Hamilton" (and after Greatest Showman film with updated dancing) was "Cats" biggest downfall.
hello the cast is good and the costumes are very beautiful, but the script is disappointing and the performances are worthy of a golden raspberry.
its horrible! Seriously, DON´T WATCH THIS MOVIE!

Cats (2019) is one of the WTF movies I have ever seen. The plots boring, nobody had unique characters in the movie, sure the gymnastics are cool, but you have to look at the abomination of the cats. The story boring, and the world-building is just not interesting. The score is MEH, and the visuals are actual demons, so if you are looking for a bad movie, this is the first movie I would recommend in a heartbeat because this movie should not have been made in the first place.  So, 2/10 why is everyone so horny?
this looks like the original cats musical went through a crackhouse
It was so bad that when the movie ended, my family applauded
I don't understand how or why this movie got made... It's hideous and deprived of all joy, and it makes no sense at all, it's like a bad acid trip... Yuck!
Looked great from the trailers, but in reality hopelessly boring.
NOTHING. DESERVES NOTHING.

A marvelous adaptation that perfectly represents its source material. The special effects are phenomenal, going beyond even Avatar. The additions to the story were nothing short of genius. This film is a must-see for any fan of the musical.

I don't even know what this movie is. It's boring and I just don't care. It's a new cat getting thrown into this random cat town and she explores. That's it. Oh and the singing. The cats only have maybe 5 lines of actual dialogue and the rest is singing. And with the cgi of the cats looking like furries it's weird and cringe. If you like this but seriously I would like to have a full fledged conversation about why you could possibly like this abomination of a movie.
Like the musical, the music & costumes were AMAZING!!!

Cats was the first musical I remember going to see as a child. I've listened to the soundtrack many times and am very familiar with the songs. I think the songs by themselves are probably the right format to enjoy Cats. It's certainly not this movie. I have so many questions about what went into the making of this movie. There are so many things about it that are so bizarre. People like Jennifer Hudson and Sir Ian McKellen are doing their best, but the whole presentation is so off-putting. It's not the worst movie I've ever seen, but this one definitely should not have been made.
I may have died briefly while watching this movie
I enjoyed the songs and the animation wasn’t too bad for the remake (reboot). Good for a musical fan if you enjoy Les Miserables.

The horror. The unspeakable horror. As bad as you've heard it to be, prepare to be surprised; it's even worse than your imagination is naturally willing to go. I can't decide if this was made by someone who wanted to destroy the stage performance's reputation, or had a really, really, REALLY creepy fetish for it in all the worst ways.
Not going to lie. I was hoping a truck would smash into the side of the cinema I was in and crush me to death about 10 minutes into the film.

I really wanted to enjoy this in some way. Get drunk and yell at the screen. It's pretty mind-boggling for the first couple minutes as you realize you're just watching actors with Snapchat filters on and then it gets so god damn boring.
I actually really enjoyed this!! If you don't take it too seriously!

This movie is by far the most abysmal thing I have ever seen in my life. Nothing about it is entertaining. The acting, cinematography, the singing every two minutes makes this film an absolute trainwreck.
This movie was so f**king retarded that even my cat hated it and I don't have a cat!
The only thing worth seeing in this awful film is the fine performances from the elder actors. The story is weak and the songs are poorly done. My children fell asleep watching it. Booo! 3/10

I love the musical CATS and when i heard they made a movie i was scared, because i knew that it probably was horrible. Unfortunately i was right. The songs were performed poorly and story was horrible. I know that the plot of CATS isn't the best, but  in this movie they made it truly stupid. The musical just isn't something you should turn in a movie, so it isn't surprising that this movie sucks

I haven't even watched it but I've seen the trailer and that's enough. My initial reaction to the first 10 seconds of the trailer was '420, watcha smoking?' 

I'm honestly sure the director was on crack. A lot of crack. 

How the everloving f*** did anyone think this was a good idea.

First the cats look very weird because they have cat faces with human noses, second the entire film was just bunch of cats singing and dancing that's it! It makes it very boring, third it's kind of cringeworthy.

Abandon all hope, you who enter here. Mayhaps the title has caught your sinful gaze, or maybe morbid curiosity has gotten the best of you; who could judge such an awful taste in topics? 
Surely, as you may have noticed, this is going to be about the truly atrocious hot garbage fire that is the movie, "Cats 2019".

I myself, am not a professional writer. In fact, I'm a self-proclaimed idiot with so little life left in me that I sat through this entire movie for the sole amusement of no one, because I'm not quite as entertaining as your average YouTuber. 

However, I find it quite easy to describe this movie as the 10th circle of hell. Thence why I will explain it in the circles of hell.

The circles are technically there to suffer endlessly, starting at the first circle; Limbo. 

Limbo is the edge of hell, according to Dante's inferno it's there where the unbaptized souls wander "Here suffer those who did not sin, yet did not have the required portal of our faith. Their punishment is the denial of Paradise". They're punished only by being exiled from God's presence forever. 
I can connect this to the movie because it felt like I was about to descent into hell the minute I typed it in my search bar, almost as if it was a horrible idea. Which it was. 

The second circle of hell is Lust, blown about by violent and endless winds. The circle of Lust is composed of an immense, rocky chasm with the structural ends of a broken bridge residing on each side, no way to cross it. It's said to contain a lightning storm which traps the souls of the lustful inside till time comes to its end. 
Now, what has this to do with cats? You poor uneducated soul… Those cats in the movie are lusting after the idea of being chosen to die in their music suicide cult, and they're also horny. For God's sake. 

The third circle of Hell is Gluttony, bombarded with rain, hail, and black snow. It's here where the soul of those gluttonous come to hang out with each other, mayhaps even consume each other as some sources say, but I do not like to think of that. 
I doubt I have to explain what resembles this in Cats 2019, but in case you still want to know, the movie itself is absolutely disgusting and yet you cannot stop it despite getting nauseous--almost like that bag of chips I ate at 7AM yesterday morning… 



Next up, there's Greed. For the crime of Greed do these souls suffer. Those clerks asquint of mind made no measured spending in life. Within the circle are occupants who are boiled alive in molten gold below, condemned for hoarding too closely or spending too freely with riches. 
This relates to the movie because to be frank, the creators were probably too greedy to make sick stacks to really study cats their faces and fur and maybe like, actually make good designs and CGI. Like holy man, man horse, was it bad! I doubt any of them has ever seen a cat in real life. 

The 5th circle is Anger, also known as Wrath. See the souls over whom anger prevailed. In the warm bath of the sun they were hateful. This is the final circle of Hell to be associated with the Seven Deadly Sins. Mayhaps a landscape of poison, yet some claim it's the fire that rages endlessly which rules the lands. It's here where the souls of the wrathful end their journey. 
Finally, I get to talk about the feeling this movie gives me. As soon as I saw the first few minutes, I was overcome by rage. How could someone ruin something so badly that it makes Dragonball Evolution look good? It's truly maddening. 

Hersey is the 6th circle of hell. Here you will find the heretics and followers of every cult and pagan sect, all buried together, burning in eternal fire. The blazing tombs and coffins will stay open until the end of time, when they will be sealed forever. 
This can be related to the movie because it felt like an endless train of suffering and it'll stay in my mind forever. It feels like an endless cycle of forever burning alive to even watch it. The music isn't even original, it's from a musical. After this, Hersey would seem like heaven. 

The 7th circle is Violence. The first ring is wholly for the violent. Because violence can be done to three persons, in three rounds it is divided: violence unto one's neighbor, unto one's self, and unto God. The first ring is related to violence, being forced to swim in endless seas of blood. The second ring is related to suicide, suffering the fate of being transformed into thorny trees and being torn apart by harpies. The third and last ring relates to blasphemy, they suffer the fate of wandering a desert of blazing sands with never-ending rain and fire. 
Any of these fates would seem like mercy compared to watching Cats 2019. The longer I watch it, the further I descent into hell. The CGI tap dance made me wish those harpies would just come to get me. Hell, even that desert sounds good. 

Fraude, the 8th circle of hell. Ten ditches leading down the final circle. Each filled with its own crimes, its own forms of punishment. The Circle of Fraud is a pitch black place that held those guilty of fraud, knowing evil; those who used lies and deception for personal gain. The circle is cut into 10 different ditches, each holding a different type of liar, and each had a different but fitting form of punishment.
This circle relates to the movie because whenever a song started, a new insanity began. And with it came a new suffering. Song after song, all about a character to never be seen again, but for what? What's the reason for it? There's no story, no interesting characters, one can only speculate why it was made. 

That which used to be the final, 9th circle, happens to be treachery. The lowest, blackest, and farthest from Heaven. This was once the last circle of hell dedicated to those people who betrayed their loved ones, friends, best friends, countries, cities, guests and even to their masters. This is also known as the former pit of hell.
It symbolizes how betrayed I felt by the movie industry for making such an abomination of a movie, just to increase the already horrific reputation CGI has. However, this is nothing compared to Cats 2019.

Finally, we've made it to the final circle, Cats 2019. One would not be able to guess that below the treachery lays something far uglier and sinful. It's hidden beneath the torments of a thousand to scare those who dare touch it's foul existence. Only the bravest of fools have dared to set foot into the insanity itself. 
This film is so butchered it ruins the entire thing. There's no plot, no fascinating characters and horrific visuals. Truly, the only thing good about it is the music, which isn't even original but taken from the musical and performed by others. However, just because it sounds nice doesn't mean it is worth it. The songs are just a way of saying, "I'm this cat and I do this" only for the character to never been seen again. The entire movie is character introduction, some suicide cult shit and this guy being evil because he's evil. The cats constantly shift sizes whenever it's convenient, and they do not give a shit about quite literally any logic. It truly made me wish I believe in God, so I had something to pray to because this movie has driven me to the point of wishing to pray for just once in my life. I pray to the fucking gods of movies to take this thing down, remove it from everyone's memory and wipe it from existence for good.
this movie was so good after the 20 minute mark I stopped watching because it was so good

Who? Who in their right mind thought that a surreal, virtually plotless musical such as Cats would lend itself well to a live-action style presented in the same structure as Les Miserables? Greedy executives who were hoping the movie would get an Oscar. Why? Because Les Miserables was nominated for Best Picture and Tom Hooper's prior film The King's Speech did win. Even though an animated movie would've worked MUCH better, especially since animated musicals don't get as much flak as live-action ones...at least, when they aren't actively aping Disney. I feel bad for the people involved because they were trying to make it work, with a few who decided to have fun (Taylor Swift) and good choreography. But man, does it appeal to nobody. Never seen the musical? The story's just an excuse to justify all these songs that give you little-to-no time to breathe. Come on, Les Mis did have quiet moments, believe it or not. Love the musical? The changes are gonna piss you off. Are you a furry? Firstly, this is a family-friendly movie...I think. Secondly, the lyrics clash with the horniness. Finally, the borderline terrifying designs (that's not mocap, by the way. It's some type of rotoscoping with software developed specifically for this movie. You'd think somebody would've taught Tom Hooper how much of a pain in the ass the animation process can be.) are guaranteed to prevent furries from being turned on by these pussies. Seriously, why didn't you just make an animated Cats movie? Especially since that WAS THE ORIGINAL PLAN FOR THE FILM ADAPTATION!!! If you like this movie, even unironically, that's okay. There's nothing wrong about it. It can feel pretty exciting being a rebel. But unfortunately, being a fan of musical movies myself (I unapologetically enjoyed a musical about newsboys going on strike, despite acknowledging the absurdity of such an idea), Cats felt like a bad fever dream, what with the freaky structure of everything (these tiny cat-monsters within those oversized sets. I don't know what the musical was like but that doesn't translate well into live-action) and the misguided attempt to capture lightning in a bottle twice. Yes, the 2012 Les Mis movie wasn't ACCLAIMED, but at least it had all the good elements that would guarantee Oscar nominations and told a coherent story despite there being very little spoken dialogue. The point is, the present that cats usually leave in their litter boxes smells better than this stinker.
A truly unforgettable disaster. Tom Hooper manages to take an already bad idea (Turning "Cats" into a live action movie) and makes it even worse than you could possibly imagine.

‘Cats' by Andrew Lloyd Webber isn't my favorite musical because, while it is visually brilliant and beautifully sung, the story is very light and minimal and the style is very dated. Nevertheless, the show was the longest-running musical from the early 1980's until the late 90's and started the long trend of family-friendly mega-blockbusters on Broadway. Based on a collection of poems by T.S. Eliot, ‘Cats' the musical introduces one Jellicle cat, it sings a dynamic number and gets cast aside among the ensemble, rinse and repeat, like fashion models on the runway. As for Cats the movie, Tom Hooper gives an already incoherent narrative a plot so the movie would seem real to the cinematic eye. Victoria the White Cat (Francesca Hayward), who has no dialogue and one dance number in the show, is the main character who goes through a journey, I guess, but barely does anything to earn her Jellicle trophy. Macavity (Idris Elba) has more screen time than the episodic show as the antagonist who kidnaps other Jellicle cats: Asparagus (Ian McKellan), Jennyanydots (Rebel Wilson), Bustopher Jones (James Corden), and Old Deuteronomy (Judi Dench). Lastly, Hooper feeds the script with terrible cat puns on par with the ones from Catwoman and suggests an even worse adlib job from Corden and Wilson. The only redeeming value in Cats the movie is the song soundtrack, performed by giants like Jennifer Hudson and Taylor Swift. Even ballerina Miss Hayward produces a beautiful innocent voice in her feature debut to incorporate with her dancing talents. Beyond that, I'll forgive the hideous humanoid cat special effects, but with the story mixed into an already plotless musical, Cats was a complete mess. (1 ½ Scary CGI Jellicles out of 5)
If you locked me in a room with a gun and a copy of Cats (2019), I would shoot myself.

I think Cats's reputation proceeds it in an unfair way. Many people expected to hate the movie, went to see it, and of course hated it. The stunning choreography and the beautiful, fun performances of already beloved songs were completely overlooked, because audiences went in ready to tear this movie apart. They were already against the basic premise of the film- people with cat fur edited onto their bodies. How could you expect it to stand a chance? Open your heart to Cats(2019). I loved it, and so can you!

Well, opinions are like belly buttons - everyone has one. Having said that, I find it hard to believe that the low Tomatometer and Audience Score for Cats is for the same movie I just watched. The music, the costumes, the dancing and the sets are all just spectacular! There's an all-star cast that are all great and the performance by Francisca Hayward as Victoria the White Cat is stunning!
Only saving grace is Jennifer Hudson’s performance of “Memory”.

No... No... Just no... The concept itself is admittedly weird but it's never been as weird as in this particular production.. The catness is so comical, I just could not get through it.. It's a shame, this talent and star power could save it..
I think this movie was a little underrated. It's not the best, and it's kind of weird, but there's some good music and good story. It's worth seeing.

Cats is not for everyone the same way that art galleries, ballet and opera are not for everyone. This movie is fine art that the average person will find confusing and boring. But if you like the fine arts you just may like it.

Take the dancing for example. The protagonist is played by Francesca Hayward who is the Principal ballerina at The Royal Ballet. She delivers a performance that is breathtaking in elegance and style. She deftly expresses mood and movement at a level of sophistication you can only hope a premier ballerina will perform. If you love ballet you will be dazzled. Brava!

The plot is vastly better than the musical play. I saw the play and thought there was not any plot to it. And I am not alone in that. But the addition of the protagonist Victoria solves that problem. Other cats explain to her what and why things are the way they are. Most importantly, the significance of the climactic scene, the Jellicle Ball. I got it! And it's good.

I could go on but I will summarize by saying great choreography and performance by everyone. The acting is superior by the pros, especially by the incomparable veterans Judy Dench and Ian McKellen. Jennifer Hudson delivers the performance of a lifetime singing "Memories". I wasn't as impressed by the acting of the headline singers but they aren't professional actors.

The commonly complained about costumes did not bother me. Cats have tails so I don't see anything wrong with them having tails. But I am thankful they decided at the last minute to edit out all the butts. Nobody wants to see that.

I will close with a bit of a joke. Taylor Swift's costume was a bit disturbing as is widely talked about. I was felling things I should not feel. Like questioning the necessity of bestiality laws. Ha. Ha.
The movie was mostly true to form from the play. The mice bit and the boat bit were a little corny but overall it was enjoyable.
Pior filme que já vi

Its not everyone's cup of tea, but I think, at some point, people will realize this is a great movie. We aren't used to seeing ballet in a musical. Some of the CGI is not great, but the dance is beautiful and it's a brave telling of the story.
Horrible adaptation. I didn't like it from the beginning and I could not even get past the first 15 minutes.
Despite the design on the characters, I can say the music is great and I can't deny Jennifer Hudson in her performance. This could possibly be a cult classic for years to come.
Better after multiple viewings. Knowing the source material and backstory is essential before watching, as it is not a good stand alone film. Very sorry for this film, it had the best intentions.
Boring movie, should keep it on Broadway!
1998 version is soooo much better! Please watch that version before you judge CATS! The 1998 version is the way it should be performed...

I truly don't care what others say about this movie. I happen to love it! I have seen the musical on stage several times, didn't really understand it until the movie came out and cleared up the confusion.

Well, I wouldn't call it bad, but I would call it boring. I think you would have to be a fan of theatre to really judge it. It would also help to be familiar with the songs and their lyrics. I'm not a part of either group, so I wasn't all that engaged. But the graphics weren't as bad as people were claiming. I had a very lukewarm reaction to it.

Aunque hayan muchos colores para el deleite y tenga alguna que otra canción bonita, Cats es una película llena de errores, incoherencias en los montajes, muchas malas actuaciones, a pesar de ser un musical, en muchas partes uno desea que paren de cantar, la mayoría de las canciones presentan a algún personaje, la forma como se diseñaron los gatos es ridícula, extraña y perturbadora  y el exceso de efectos visuales hacen pensar que una película animada era mejor opción.
